page.title: 08GOVERNMENT
page.content: On 9th May 1985 I went on a visit to the local fire station. We discovered that the station has 10 part time firemen although there should be 15. There is a station officer, a sub officer, a leading fireman and the rest are ordinary firemen. They have one fire engine which is a diesel automatic. On the engine they carry hoses,cutting equipment,walkie-talkie radios,a feather weight pump,salvage sheets and a dosimitor which measures radiation. Last year they had 307 calls one of which was to rescue a heron which was trapped in a tree.They get some false alarms caused mainly by children. The firemen are on call 14 hours a day,7 days a week.We were told that they do not have many calls on bonfire night because nowadays people go to organised bonfires.
